items.sentence: I don\'t think Tom has very many friends in Boston.
I don\'t think Tom knows where Mary parked her car.
I don\'t think Tom understood what he needed to do.
I don\'t think Tom wants to go to Boston with Mary.
Tom could hardly make himself understood in French.
Tom could have done better if he had had more time.
Tom could see that Mary was on the verge of crying.
Tom could tell right away that Mary was in trouble.
Tell Tom I need to talk to him as soon as possible.
The South Pole is a lot colder than the North Pole.
